name_title: Dickies® Womens V-Neck Scrub Top
description: Multi-functional pockets and a loosely fitting waist make this v-neck scrub top ideal for long work days. v-neck junior fit empire waist short sleeves princess seams side vents front patch pockets 26" center back length cotton/polyester washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"For size reference, I am 5'1\"... I weigh about 130... I don't know my bust line in inches but I am a 36-B. I have a short torso, and even though I am short I usually do not wear petite sizes well. Okay. This scrub top is great for me. True to size if you consider my measurements and that I am usually ordering XS in other brands and I am by no means XS. I order a S in Dickies brands and it fits exactly how I want it to. I like my scrubs to Be form flattering but not be restrictive or skin tight. So if you like your scrubs to be loose and baggy, you should go up a size, maybe 2 if you are used to ordering scrubs that run large. This scrub top is very comfortable. The V doesn't come down too low so I don't have to worry about cleavage, and the material is cottony and comfortable. I purchased a couple of these in the mock wrap style by this same brand and they were so uncomfortable for me, so I ordered more of these to replace those. Great comfortable basic scrub top."}, {"review_2"=>"The tops run small so order a size up. I wear a size medium in tops which is what I ordered but to be comfortable I should have went a size up other than the sizing issue this top is very comfortable and flattering. I ordered more in a size large"}, {"review_3"=>"I ordered an xl as I am top heavy but even that was too small across my upper body the bottoms fit well. When I went back to try and order a 2x that is when I found out they only go as high as xl. So now I'm stuck with a top I can't wear!"}, {"review_4"=>"I purchased these scrub top to match the pants and they were horrible. I loved the matching pants and those fit well however, the tops ran so small that I could not get into them. I ordered a medium and that was too small and then ordered a large and even that was too small. I normally wear a medium in every other brand."}, {"review_5"=>"I ordered this in a large and the fit was very small. Ordered the XL and it fit perfectly. I usually wear a medium to large top in other uniform clothing."}, {"review_6"=>"I usually use grey's anatomy scrubs first time buying dickies was really happy trying it out."}, {"review_7"=>"I have never bought Dickies scrubs before and ordered it online so I was not sure what to expect. When it arrived, I tried it on right away and the fit was very nice, form fitting and made me look good in a scrub top...that isn't always easy!! The feel was comfortable and the fit was professional and curved in alittle bit so it was more form fitting. VERY NICE."}]}

Please follow the recommended care instructions on the label and keep the lint trap clean on your dryer.   You can purchase these towels individually, but your best value is to buy the six-piece set together. The set will give your bathroom a coordinated look and feel while saving you money.Care tip: Avoid contact with skincare products to help minimize towel spotting or bleaching.
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I purchased these towels and paired them with coordinating solid colors to make hooded towels for my \"grand-neighbors\". As always I prewashed the towels. I was pleasantly surprised at how little lint these towels had. One down side to the printed towel is they are white on the reverse side. For my purpose this made no difference. However, I would have not chosen the prints for every day use due of the lack of print on both sides. I did not see white on one side in any of the product details. They appear to be good quality for the price. I will reap the rewards of this purchase when I see the \"grand-neighbors\" using their bright hooded towels."}, {"review_2"=>"Gave these as part of a Bridal Sower gift. name_title: Isotonic® Iso-Cool® Memory Foam Contour Pillow
description: Sleep Better™ with the supremely plush Isotonic contour memory foam pillow that equalizes pressure and reduces tension.   300 thread-count cotton cover is zippered and hypoallergenic Outlast® Adaptive Comfort™ technology regulates body temperature, absorbing and releasing body heat as needed contour shape promotes neck and shoulder comfort Sold individually. Visco-elastic memory foam measures 14½x20½x5"H. Cover is washable; spot clean foam. Manufacturer's 5-year warranty. Made in America of imported materials. Be sure to care for your investment with a pillow protector. It's an added layer of protection that will help keep your pillow clean and fresh.
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I bought 2 of these pillows, one for our daughter & one for myself. We have TMJ & suffer with the effects....headaches, neck & shoulder pain....I had an Orthopedic Pillow & needed a new one & I knew our daughter was needing one too. We also like the \"cool\" aspect of this pillow; such a nice addition for older women with hot flashes! The pillow is a little softer than what I expected, but it still helps. It has a nice pillow cover to protect the pillow itself, nicer than others I've seen. It does have a little odor, as others have mentioned, but the smell lessens with time airing out. Our daughter noticed it too, but it didn't bother her & I expected it would, as she is very sensitive. She too, loves her new pillow! The pillow does still have a slight odor even after having it for awhile now, but I like to spray a lavender scent on my pillow at night & that seems to help too. (I spray it only on the pillow case, not the pillow itself.) I also like the warranty of 5 years."}, {"review_2"=>"I really wanted to like this pillow. I own older 10 year old version of this pillow and I loved it. Over the years it started to disintegrate. This pillow is Visco-elastic memory foam which is filler to memory to keep it from sinking down. Real memory that has memory is polyurethane foam. I didn't know that at the time of ordering. I guess they added the filler because of customers complaining of memory pillows flattening down while sleeping; which is true for memory foam. Good ones are high density. This one on the other side has no memory. You apply pressure and it returns right back. It feels more like high density foam from the craft store. It does not form around your head. I'm 6' tall side sleeper and when I put my neck on the pillow pillow is fighting it back into unnatural position. I tried to push it back with my neck to keep it in natural position. Then it gives me neck pressure and headache. For 3 months me and my husband tried to sleep on this pillow and it ended on the floor every time. It is excellent for back support when watching TV. The pillow has no cooling feature. The cooling is on the upper side of pillowcase only. So you can take it off and put it on better feeling pillow. The pillow looks good and has no chemical smell. Now, if you have just the right distance of the neck versus head, this pillow just might be it for you. For us it didn't happen."}, {"review_3"=>"For the average person, this would probably be ab excellent pillow. But, I have arthritis in 4 discs in my neck, so I haved a lot of pain when trying to sleep. I have used a pillow purchased from my chiropractor that I wanted to replace since it's a few years old, so I was hoping this would be a good replacement. Back to the chiropractor to get another from him instead. This one was just a bit too firm, and gave me a headache if I laid on my back. Problems on side as well as the center of the pillow is not quite low enough and didn't keep me aligned correctly. . If it had been just a little bit softer with a little deeper center, it would have been perfect. The quality is very good in both the pillow and cover."}, {"review_4"=>"I was hesitant to drop what I considered big bucks on a pillow but after waking up almost every morning with a kink in my neck and a blinding headache, I took the plunge. I normally slept on 2 pillows and I still use an extra flatter pillow under this one but it has made an incredible difference in my sleep."}, {"review_5"=>"The first thing I noticed was that it smelled pretty bad - like commercial processing but the packaging warns you of this and after airing it out for 3-4 days it smells just fine now. The second thing I noticed was how wonderfully cool it felt - no need to flip it like the old ones. The wave form supports my neck and also prevents me from slipping off the pillow (which I did when using my old pillows - hence crick in neck). I give it all AAAs. No neck pain, no headaches! You won't be disappointed."}, {"review_6"=>"The pillow provides perfect neck alignment and an excellent night's sleep. Using standard pillows my neck would be stiff and achy. This is the first pillow that facilitates true comfort and relaxation and the cool feel is pleasant regardless of the temperature outside. I purchased a set for the master bed and the kids fell in love with them so I took advantage of discounts and purchased them for the kids' beds as well. Love the pillows -- wish they sold replacement covers, but the company won't budge."}, {"review_7"=>"I bought this as a replacement for a similar pillow I have had for several years. I am very happy with it. The fit when I am in side-lying keeps my shoulder from hurting. I use a standard pillow case over the one provided for ease in keeping it oil free. And I like a smother finish to keep bed head to a minimum."}, {"review_8"=>"I wanted a pillow with the cooling effect along with being contour for my husband. He really likes the contour part of the pillow, but it is not very cooling. I wouldn't buy another."}, {"review_9"=>"This is a great pillow! I love the cool feeling. It is very comfortable!"}]}

The other neutrals are great under cardigans or light weight blouses and I also wear mine around the house a lot. I also work out in mine. They are flattering no matter where you are wearing them. FYI the only reason I have two sets of most colors is because I wore some when I was pregnant all the way until the last day and I feel they stretched some but that was my fault and these actually wash extremely well. I wear one almost every single day and have had each one for at least three years (some five) and the fabric looks and feels brand new. I will agree with other reviewers that I would buy even more in other colors too. Make sure to get these on sale and they will pay for themselves VERY quickly."}, {"review_6"=>"I ordered the Large/XL and they did not even come close to fitting. I wanted a classic stretchy body hugging smooth not confining fit that would not cling to sheer tops but could be worn alone. That's not to much to ask so I thought. Then I found the Worthington Seamless Cami and my search was over. Never again will I need to look any further this one is just right. I bought both the regular and petite size (fits about 1-1/2 inches shorter) in several colors. The best Cami ever and what a great price!!!"}]}

It seems they are skimping on the material as the last few pairs I have tried on have been slightly smaller than those in my closet. I haven't relied on how they fit, but actually measured them against the ones I already have. The length, however, is another story. While I used to get by with just wearing them on the long side, the last few pairs I purchased of a different line had to be taken to the seamstress to be shortened. I realize at just over 5 foot that I'm short, but when they are 6 inches too long I don't see how they qualify as \"short\". Unlike another reviewer, I hardly ever see petites in my store and wish they would carry more."}, {"review_2"=>"Needed a pair of dressier slacks to wear with my blouses and tops that were on the fancier side. I had jeans and chinos, but the tops needed a dressier type fabric. These look great, feel great and the best part was I did not have to hem them! I ordered the short version of this style and it was perfect."}, {"review_3"=>"My wife has been looking for pants that fit right and look good. She is happy withe these. She states how comfortable they are and is pleased with the pockets. She bought 4 pair and is pleased with them all. And I think she looks great in them."}, {"review_4"=>"This pant is so good for work and looks great too! Feels very comfortable!"}, {"review_5"=>"Alfred Dunner clothing fit the plus size body extremely well. I've come to expect and appreciate the quality of the product. They have been around for many years, and I've seen like products that were comparable in style vanish from stores. Thank goodness Alfred Dunner is still around. I'd be lost without there Pull-on slacks/pants to purchase. No others in recent years fit as well."}, {"review_6"=>"Love these pants. They are light, easy care, and can be casual or dressy too. More colors would be great, like a dark grey, maybe another blue, too.Fit is good too."}, {"review_7"=>"I needed a pair of pants in a hurry as I had to attend a funeral. Usually can't find my size but they were available and fit just fine. The legs are a little too full but other wise they fit good. Are a good value for the price."}, {"review_8"=>"Excellent product for the money. Always a good fit when I purchase this brand. I am very pleased with the color, the price, and the fit."}]}

name_title: Xersion™ Slim-Fit Pants
description: Xersion slim-fit active pants are a year-around staple for every woman on the move.   tight compression fit provides added comfort during workouts Quick-Dri® moisture-wicking fabric no-chafe seams UV protection credit card pocket 31½" inseam polyester/spandex washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"These pants are very comfortable. I am no longer able to wear tight pants or jeans due to an illness so I began the search for something looser fitting. I was a bit unsure of what to get but when I saw these I decided to give them a try. I wear them when we are out running errands and for doctor appts, etc. As for size I am 5'3\" & 160 lbs and I wear the \"XL Short\" but can also wear size \"L Short\" if I want the legs to be a bit tighter (but the tummy and waist are also more snug in the size \"Large\", ha!). Hope this helps, I always wish people would give their size and weight so I could know if I would be able to wear things."}, {"review_2"=>"I really loved the style of these pants and JCP didn't have them in a tall size, so I thought I'd try a regular inseam. They are super short ... I need just a 33.5-34\" inseam and I think these were closer to barely 30\"."}, {"review_3"=>"I'm built straight up and down, with not much of a waist and narrow hips and thighs and a normal/regular belly. These pants were big in the waist and tight in the thighs, which is normally a good fit for my body type, but not with these. There is no string at the waist to adjust them, and the rise is so low, (maybe an 8\" rise??) that there would be no way they would stay up. I couldn't go up a size to have a bigger thigh bc then the waist and butt would be huge."}, {"review_4"=>"Still, they are very nicely made and the seaming on them made them really flattering. Had they been available in a tall length I would have repurchased them and taken them to a tailor to take them in at the waist, bc I really did like them that much."}, {"review_5"=>"Bummer! JCP -- you say you sell Talls, but they're rarely ever available!"}, {"review_6"=>"These fit good, feel good, and had a great price. Hope they last a long time too."}, {"review_7"=>"I absolutely LOVE these pants.I have 3 pairs of black and 3 pairs of gray. Really comfortable, Fit in length is really good!"}, {"review_8"=>"I have 10 pairs of these pants. I wear them every day to work, gym, everywhere. That being said, I just purchased 2 blacks and 2 grays to keep my stock up (they're saved in my favorites so I know I ordered the same ones as always). I was just going to hang them in the closet but decided to try them on just to make sure of the fit, etc. Imagine my surprise when I had to shimmy into them. If I wanted a girdle, I would have bought one.So here's my scathing review of these miserable pants:I am 5'4\" with an inseam of 30\". The average length is not.NEW inseam=33-1/4\". ORIGINAL=32\".NEW rise=11\". ORIGINAL=10\".The NEW Slim-Fit cut is 1/2\" more narrow than the ORIGINAL (N=8-1/4\" at knee vs O=8-3/4\" at the knee).The fabric content has not changed so I do not understand the difference in the feel of the fabric but it does feel thinner, cheaper. The country of origin has not changed either. The only thing that has changed is the pattern shape.Finally analysis: The new pattern sits higher on the waist, is longer on the length, and slimmer on the leg.If this is how the pants are going to continue I will be taking them off my favorites list because nobody should have to shimmy into their clothes-ever."}, {"review_9"=>"These pants are fantastic for exercise or dance. True to size in my opinion, look great, quality stitching, and I can move my legs freely. Good buy"}, {"review_10"=>"I have skinny legs (below my knees) and have stayed away from yoga pants since they've become popular. I love these pants. I wore them today for the first time and received compliments from my friends."}, {"review_11"=>"My new Xersion slim-fit pants are true to size which means I do not feel like an encased sausage while I am working out at the local gym nor do I look like one. I wish that the pocket was bigger but that is really of no consequence. These pants launder beautifully and do not draw up neither do they get baggy during wear. I really like that they come in petites so that I did not have to do any alterations. All in all they are a good wearing experience."}]}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I'm 5' 11\" and knew the 30\" inseam would come up a little short. Instead of ankle pants, these come down to about mid-calf. The material is stretchy, comfortable and not restricting. I prefer pants that come down to my ankle to meet a pair of ankle booties so I bought these in tall and the length was perfect! They are not tight around the ankle but they come very close. I highly suggest not putting them in the dryer because they will shrink slightly lengthwise. Wash on gentle cycle, hang dry and iron. They do become a little baggy by the end of the day. I have 6 pairs in 5 colors! For reference: I'm 5'7\", 206lbs and bought these in a size 16 Tall."}, {"review_5"=>"LOVE THESE ANKLE PANTS! I did that and that makes them perfect on me, hitting right at the ankle. They wash and dry perfectly, and need only a light ironing before wearing."}, {"review_9"=>"These pants are great, I purchased some last year, and purchased some of the new colors this year. The teaberry bubble has a design in the fabric, that resembles a pique or diamond, and the color is like a bright coral, very pretty. The others are a plain fabric. The fit is nice and figure flattering with more of a slim straight leg. Can be dressed up or down depending on what top you wear and how you accessorize. Sizing is pretty much true to size."}]}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I bought the blue 3qt, love baking casseroles, cobblers, chicken, meat loaf. This is easily my favorite bakeware."}, {"review_2"=>"I use it every day for cooking dinner."}, {"review_3"=>"This dish cracked after having been used approximately 3 times. I kept used it, thinking the cracks were superficial, but the dish finally completely broke. What a disappointment. Corningware has always been a reliable product until these new pieces of junk came out. Next time, I'll just fork over the money and buy fiestaware."}, {"review_4"=>"Love my new Corning bake ware. I got the yellow which match perfectly with my kitchen decor.."}, {"review_5"=>"I used this to make apple turnovers. They were cooked perfectly. The pan was easy to clean when I finished baking. Would definitely buy again."}, {"review_6"=>"This casserole dish caught my eye because I needed something bigger than the square Pyrex baking dish I've been using and liked that it was ceramic instead of metal or glass plus the yellow color was appealing to me. The dish comes with a long list of care and use instructions which I read before using it. The first time I used it I baked chicken in it and all went well and it cleaned up with minimum effort. Then I didn't use it for a couple of months until this past weekend when again I baked chicken it. I turned the chicken halfway through the cooking time and then sometime after that and before the time was up I heard a popping sound which sounded like grease splattering but then when it was time to take the chicken out I opened the oven and the dish had cracked/split into two pieces! Now the use instructions warn that drastic temperature changes can cause the dish to crack such as when you take a hot dish and pour cold water in it, etc... but the dish never left the oven. When I turned the chicken I simply pulled the oven rack out never touching the dish and turned the chicken never touching any part of the dish nor did I add any liquid or anything else to the pan before pushing the rack back in and closing the door. Now if opening the oven door for no more than a minute would be considered to cause a \"drastic temperature change\" then this product shouldn't be on the market. Well it shouldn't be on the market anyway and what was left of mine went in the garbage because I had long ago thrown the receipt away."}, {"review_7"=>"needs a lid that seals!!!!"}, {"review_8"=>"great product"}]}

name_title: Levi’s® 508™ Regular Taper Jeans
description: Levi's 508 jeans are defined by their classic comfort and modern tapered fit.   sits below waist zipper fly, button closure 5-pocket styling tapered legs, 14¼" opening regular fit  rinsed playa: 98% cotton/2% elastane black/black 3D: 99% cotton/1% elastane gray/black 3D: 65% cotton/33% polyester/2% elastane black indigo: 98.5% cotton/1.5% elastane other colors: 100% cotton others: cotton/elastane washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I bought these jeans for my son-in-law for Christmas. After only 7 weeks of normal wear, there were 2 holes in the knee! Have purchased Levis several times over the years and have never had this happen! Sure wish they could be replaced!"}, {"review_2"=>"wow, i just got these yesterday and I really liked them when i saw them so i had to get them. the style is perfect and the tappered leg is a plus, but thats where all the positive for me ends. Now let me get to the disappointment.. I wear a size 34x30 and they fir just a tad bit loose but when washed that problem is gone, with that being said since iI already know my size I just got the pair of the grey black 3D color. when i got home and decide to put them on I was in so much shock to see how huge they where on me! this 34 size waist fit like a 36 waist maybe even a 38 because the stretch. whats up with that? arent all 34 waist jeans from levis supposed to be the same fit? looked further into this issue and found out that the color, GREY BLACK 3D, is not actually a pair of jeans because it is 65%cotton, 33%polyester, and 2%elastane. so in my opinion this is not a pair of jeans its not denim or 100%cotton and for the price you could get other levis 100% cotton. i do love the 508 line but ill stick to the 508's that are 100% cotton and better quality in my opinion- a few are british khaky, rigid envy, etc.. those are 508's and are 100%cotton. if you get any other color with the mix of 3 material build i suggest you get a size down as i am going to exchange my 34x30 pair for a 32x30 and that should do they trick. im still very confused by this odd sizing for the 508 line. I will include a picture so you can see what im saying. the pair in question will be at the bottom,which is not 100%cotton and the 100%cotton pair of 508's will be at the top so you can see how much bigger the ones that are not 100%cotton are. keep in mind they are both 508's 34Wx30L so they should be exactly the same... look at how much of the grey black 3D pair stick out from under the all 100%cotton 508 on top, which is true to size."}, {"review_3"=>"They weren't really the correct size, they said 40 but they were more like 38"}, {"review_4"=>"I bought my first pair of Levi 508 and absolutely loved the fit. My wife was not a fan of Levi's until I bought the 508's. I just purchased my second pair in the Rigid Envy color. These are great pants if you like the narrower bottom pants. They look good rolled up with boots or down with loafers. They are a better fit and value than any designer pocket fancy jeans you see guys wearing."}, {"review_5"=>"Stumbled across this style. I reminds me of 508s of my youth before the HUGE leg openings were implemented. I like it!"}, {"review_6"=>"I had a pair of 508s before I purchased the Khaki version.They are still the best fitting jeans I've worn to this day. The fit may be a little tight depending on how big your legs are, but they tend to stretch a little after wear."}, {"review_7"=>"These aren't the cheapest jeans out there. You can find great fitting jeans that will be on par fit-wise to these jeans for a third of the price. The reason I keep buying them? They look GOOD. Those other jeans fit well but they don't have the same appeal as these jeans. I'm a jeans kind of guy, but I know that these jeans stand out from the rest, allowing me to stand out in a crowd even when that crowd is also wearing jeans. That's why when my first pair of these jeans got too faded (from wearing them way too much, not the jeans fault at all), I ordered another pair of the exact same jeans. They're my go-to pair for events where I need to look good but can get away with not wearing dressier pants."}, {"review_8"=>"I have always worn Levi 512 until they stopped making them, I looked and tried several styles and brands, not really finding anything that came close to the 512's. They were either too baggy in the legs, or if I got skinny jeans thet sat too low at the waist and uncomfortable for me as I'm in a wheelchair. I came across the 508's and read the description which sounded like the perfect fit for me, a normal fit in seat and waist and a tapered leg which is what I like. Bought a pair to try for fit and feel, they were perfect ! Bought two more since, these are now my replacement jeans for the 512's, in fact these would be better than the 512's if only they made them in the heavier denim rather than the new thin stuff they now use. I am happy and would recommend former 512 users give them a try."}]}

name_title: Danny & Nicole® Sleeveless Printed Fit-and-Flare Dress
description: Loaded with fashion-forward touches, our pretty fit-and-flare dress gives you a fit and print that flatters every figure and then ups the ante just a touch with a little neck detail. scoopneck with metal detail sleeveless exposed zipper approx. 38" length from shoulder polyester/spandex washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"The dress is scuba material so it holds you in where you want it to and stretches where you need it to... It has pleats in the front and pleats in the back... The pleats actually don't stick out in the front like some other dresses that will make you look fat... These pleats in the front are more flat and flattering... The dress also comes in nicely at the waist and flares well at the hips... The pleats in the back are a bit too wide spread if you have a large behind but it can still look nice if you're not too large in your backside.. The arms holes are a touch tight on me, but I had to buy a very small size so I could fit my waist, so I am guessing if I bought a size to fit the rest of me, the arm holes wouldn't bother me... All in all, this dress is really flattering and the colors are really pretty and I definitely recommend it!"}, {"review_2"=>"This is a beautiful dress with vibrant summer colors, but not too bright. Fit is perfect even for me, I am 5ft. tall and usually have to wear petite sizes, but this one works. True to size as well."}, {"review_3"=>"I purchased this dress to take to Florida. It's colors are vivid and pretty - the dress fits great - it IS true to size. Very flattering design. Looks great with just a pair of flat sandals or heels."}]}

name_title: Madison Park Lavinia 6-pc. Quilted Coverlet Set
description: A classic paisley print in contrasting brown and blue gives this coverlet set a timeless look that's accented with coordinating print accessories for a rich, full new look. chocolate brown with baby blue and ivory colored paisley brown border on coverlet and shams decorative pillows feature embroidery, tucking and pleating details 6-piece sets include: coverlet 2 shams 3 decorative pillows Full/Queen sets include standard shams. King: coverlet is 104x94"; shams are 36x20"; decorative pillows are 18x18", 16x16" and 18x12" For best results, launder in a large-capacity front-loading washer and dryer. If the coverlet doesn't have free movement in the washer and dryer, a large-capacity commercial washer and dryer are recommended.
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"The color was faded and not as rich as it looks in the picture, a lighter brown and pale aqua. The pattern is only on the lower third of the quilt. The rest is brown. Didn't look like a quality quilt. The pillows were a nice accent but needed because the quilt color was boring."}, {"review_2"=>"I have shopped with Jcp for many years. Jcp has been my go to for bedding and window items. I wanted to change up my bed with a new quilt or bedspread for the upcoming spring. I was looking for something that would be lightweight and airy in colors. I also wanted something that would coordinate with my existing light slate blue drapes, valances, area rugs and navy blue pillows/bedrest. When I saw this set I thought it would go well. Presently have another Jcp quilt that has blues (lt.- drk) ivory and browns (lt.- drk). I recieved the set yesterday and sorry to say that the stated Baby Blue is in fact more of a light turquoise blue. Anyone who might be looking for the Baby Blue like I was will also be disappointed. I'm on the fence as to whether I want to change out my window coverings ($$$) or return this set. I have to add that I got this set at an incredible price; shipping was high."}, {"review_3"=>"So does a husband want a bedspread that pleases the wife but isn't too feminine? This husband does. It is 'our' bed. The coloring here a male can enjoy while the decorations are feminine. I only asked that the tiny white pillow be removed from the bed -- but the others are as handsome as they are pretty. A really SMART design."}, {"review_4"=>"In cold days you'll need a warm blanket underneath. I'd recommend a dark chocolate Vellux that JCP sells. Otherwise -- it's good to go. Paired with a Liz Clairborne Crema color sheets."}, {"review_5"=>"This was well made quilt, but too long on the sides and too short length-wise."}, {"review_6"=>"This Item is well made and makes the bedroom new without doing any painting."}, {"review_7"=>"This would be a very nice quilt if the pattern would have been centered on the quilt. The print is off centered and gives it a cheap look. All it would have taken is for the company to have used a little more fabric and centered the paisley print. Please note that about 34\" on the top half of the quilt is brown and not the paisley pattern (this is measured on a full/queen quilt)."}, {"review_8"=>"I recently purchased this set for my bedroom and I am so IN LOVE with it. name_title: Made For Life™ Secretly Slender Leggings - Tall
description: Our Secretly Slender jersey knit leggings feature a compression panel at the waist for extra support that slims your silhouette while keeping you comfortable. mid rise black: cotton/spandex charcoal: cotton/polyester/spandex washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I was looking for a pair of black pants that would be comfy, casual and not fade when washed. As a tall woman, this isn't very easy! Thinking about ordering another pair!"}, {"review_6"=>"These leggings have so many things going for them. They are well made of nice fabric. They are not see-through at all, and have lots of stretch. These leggings are extremely comfortable!"}, {"review_7"=>"My favorite thing about these leggings is how long they are! The Medium Tall has a 32.5\" inseam. name_title: Royal Velvet® Matte Satin Square 3-pc. Coverlet Set
description: Add a 5-star resort feel to your bedroom with the elegant Matte Satin Square coverlet set, featuring modern embroidered squares and flanged trim.   square embroidered pattern flanged-edge trim fabric is washable for easy care 3-piece set includes: coverlet 2 shams Polyester coverlet with cotton fill; polyester shams. Washable. Imported. Full/Queen: coverlet is 92x96" King: coverlet is 110x96"
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"Affordable luxury – two great words, and when they are combined in one product – shopping happiness. The Royal Velvet quilt may be the nicest thing I have ever purchased for our home. Though it can be used as a beautiful coverlet/quilt, we have chosen to use ours as a blanket, sandwiched in between our flannel sheets and our bed coverlet. I love to fold the top of the satiny smooth edge over the sheet and feel its’ silkiness under my chin. Ummmm. Bye the way, I washed both the quilt and the two lovely pillow covers, and they laundered up wonderfully. No wrinkles and the stitching tight. They seem very well made. My only problem with them – I wish I could afford more! All the colors are stunning (and would look great stacked on my shelf…….. just saying….."}, {"review_2"=>"Purchased this in the Dark Raisin (eggplant) color. Compared to my usual heavy comforter set this is lightweight. It fit onto my King bed (non cal-king) just as shown in the jc penny online photo for this product. I anticipated it would need a bed skirt.I usually prefer a cotton quilt coverlet, but this is a nice change from the norm. Fabric is polyester and has a matte finish to it, not shiny. Just received it, haven't washed it yet, hoping that it will be easy to care for."}, {"review_3"=>"I'm very happy with the queen size Royal Velvet coverlet set I purchased for my queen bed. First of all, it is very well made. Because of its generous size, it covers my sheets and blanket completely, and I don't have to use a dust ruffle. It falls right in the middle of the bedrails - perfect for today's modern look. Constructed of 100% polyester, it has a slight sheen and is warm enough for three seasons. It goes beautifully with both modern and traditional décor."}, {"review_4"=>"This set is well worth the price. The coverlet was true to size, and soft to the touch. It easily fits into my washer and dryer to be cleaned. The white is true to color."}, {"review_5"=>"I only hope the manufacturer will continue to produce this wonderful product. My house isn't large enough to warehouse a stack of these coverlets, but after a number of years I would replace the two I purchased with the same ones and perhaps other colors besides the true ivory and pewter."}, {"review_6"=>"The more I looked at it online, I decided that it was too dressy for me. It was beautiful but I really needed something that I could keep on my bed every day. I went into the store and had it returned because by then I had already ordered one more suitable for my lifestyle. I loved it but it was not for me."}, {"review_7"=>"I purchased the pewter color and the website color matched the actual product. I love the look of this on my bed. We purchased a king size for our queen sized bed, as I like having extra on the sides and foot. We have had this coverlet for 3 months and so far so good. Our last coverlet had looser stitching and some of it came loose or broke over the years. I am hoping to not have the same issue with this one. Haven't had it long enough to say for sure. We have this on top of our bed with a fleece blanket underneath, then our sheets. It is winter and so far, has been plenty warm with our set up. I was worried that the color would be too dark for our room, as it is on the small size, but it compliments our cherry furniture nicely.I would not have paid the full price for this coverlet, as I don't like to pay full price for anything. I managed to get a very very good price with it being on sale and having additional coupons, so for me, it has been a very good value for the price I paid."}, {"review_8"=>"The bed cover was well made and had a nice finish to the material. Unfortunately it was not the correct color for my bedroom.master"}]}

name_title: St. John's Bay® Secretly Slender Capris

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I am a petite size and singular frame and for years now I have found products in line with my taste and requirements in this store. What impresses me always is the reasonable pricing with absolutely no compromise of quality ! The customer care is absolutely great !"}, {"review_2"=>"I love the way these look and fit . I like Capri a little lose not skin tight so I went up a size from a size 10 to a 12 . Going up a size actually made me look smaller thru my thighs and hung really nice and made me look thinner !! The pants have stretch to them ( 98% cotton and 2% spandex) which makes them extremely comfortable ( I'm longer thru the inseam and going up a size was extremely comfortable without at all being baggy ) and the length is about 6 in below knee - perfect ! They have beautiful colors like robin egg , yellow , taupe colored ect ! Very classy looking - great for church !! They are true to fit ( jcpenny's has changed their clothing sizing - things fit much smaller than before) IF you like them form fitting or skin tight otherwise go up one , you wont be disappointed!"}, {"review_3"=>"I just keep buying more colors. I am hopeful I will be able to take it out."}]}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"These are LITERALLY the best jeans I have ever worn. Being a larger size, older man, I have trouble finding clothes that fit well. Jeans were almost completely out of the picture. I wasn't sure about the Boot Jeans when I got them, but when I put them on, all doubt faded. The fit was great - and this is coming from a guy who's jeans have over the years felt like leotards, or made me look a great deal heavier than I liked. These Arizonas are perfect and I get compliments when wearing them. At my age,compliments are rare and every bit counts!! To all you older guys out there who like me are a bit fuller than we used to be, this jean may very well be for you. It has a slim style, but with a nice amount of room in the seat and thigh - unusual for a boot jean. The next plus is the price, and I have found Penny's customer service to be spectacular as well. I don't plan on shopping at many other establishments after ordering from Pennys. Do it today!! You won't be disappointed."}, {"review_2"=>"The jeans are great. Care tip: Some lint may be observed in the first few launderings of towels, and will diminish with each subsequent laundering. This does not affect the look, feel or performance of your towels. Please follow the recommended care instructions on the label and keep the lint trap clean on your dryer. Care tip: Avoid contact with skincare products to help minimize towel spotting or bleaching. Eco-friendly tip: This towel is made with long-lasting quality in mind. Give it a second life when you're through with it by donating it to a local charity instead of discarding in the trash.  **This product meets the Green Good Housekeeping Seal environmental standard for Textiles for following strict industry standard and energy-efficient production processes and for J.C. Penney's corporate social responsibility efforts.

Reviews: {"review"=>{"review_1"=>"I bought this pan about 2 months ago and have used it to grill fish, chicken, beef, baguette & panninis. Then sprinkle with Kosher salt and use a damp sponge that has a mild abrasive side. Scrub the pan lightly until clean and then rinse and dry. Voila!! the pan is like new. I would definitely recommend this pan, along with this cleaning technique. I forgot to mention that the red looks fantastic with the décor in my kitchen so it never has to be hidden in a cupboard!!"}}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I really loved the style of these pants and JCP didn't have them in a tall size, so I thought I'd try a regular inseam. They are super short ... There is no string at the waist to adjust them, and the rise is so low, (maybe an 8\" rise??) that there would be no way they would stay up. JCP -- you say you sell Talls, but they're rarely ever available!"}, {"review_5"=>"These pants are very comfortable. I am no longer able to wear tight pants or jeans due to an illness so I began the search for something looser fitting. I was a bit unsure of what to get but when I saw these I decided to give them a try. I wear them when we are out running errands and for doctor appts, etc. As for size I am 5'3\" & 160 lbs and I wear the \"XL Short\" but can also wear size \"L Short\" if I want the legs to be a bit tighter (but the tummy and waist are also more snug in the size \"Large\", ha!). Hope this helps, I always wish people would give their size and weight so I could know if I would be able to wear things."}, {"review_6"=>"These fit good, feel good, and had a great price. Hope they last a long time too."}, {"review_7"=>"I have 10 pairs of these pants. I wear them every day to work, gym, everywhere. That being said, I just purchased 2 blacks and 2 grays to keep my stock up (they're saved in my favorites so I know I ordered the same ones as always). I was just going to hang them in the closet but decided to try them on just to make sure of the fit, etc. Imagine my surprise when I had to shimmy into them. If I wanted a girdle, I would have bought one.So here's my scathing review of these miserable pants:I am 5'4\" with an inseam of 30\". The average length is not.NEW inseam=33-1/4\". ORIGINAL=32\".NEW rise=11\". ORIGINAL=10\".The NEW Slim-Fit cut is 1/2\" more narrow than the ORIGINAL (N=8-1/4\" at knee vs O=8-3/4\" at the knee).The fabric content has not changed so I do not understand the difference in the feel of the fabric but it does feel thinner, cheaper. The country of origin has not changed either. The only thing that has changed is the pattern shape.Finally analysis: The new pattern sits higher on the waist, is longer on the length, and slimmer on the leg.If this is how the pants are going to continue I will be taking them off my favorites list because nobody should have to shimmy into their clothes-ever."}, {"review_8"=>"I absolutely LOVE these pants.I have 3 pairs of black and 3 pairs of gray. Really comfortable, Fit in length is really good!"}, {"review_9"=>"These pants are fantastic for exercise or dance. True to size in my opinion, look great, quality stitching, and I can move my legs freely. Good buy"}, {"review_10"=>"I have skinny legs (below my knees) and have stayed away from yoga pants since they've become popular. I love these pants. I wore them today for the first time and received compliments from my friends."}, {"review_11"=>"My new Xersion slim-fit pants are true to size which means I do not feel like an encased sausage while I am working out at the local gym nor do I look like one. I wish that the pocket was bigger but that is really of no consequence. These pants launder beautifully and do not draw up neither do they get baggy during wear. I really like that they come in petites so that I did not have to do any alterations. All in all they are a good wearing experience."}]}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I bought these (2pair) online, but they were way too big. I returned them and went to the department to see what i could find. I found a whole rack of marked down pants in 16 regular and they fit everywhere except the length. If your 6ft. or taller I recommend them. As it was, i bought them and had to cut off 3\" and hem at 3\"more. As I am 5'7\" i don't consider myself \"petite\", but in this case I guess I should have checked petites. I must say I am thrilled with the blue pair (they were slightly more expensive than the black pair) the material is soft and extremely comfortable. So, although I didn't purchase the pair here (plus size), I did find two pairs in-store that were the same manufacturer and style. If you don't mind hemming, they are very comfortable. Note: the inseam measured 35\"."}, {"review_2"=>"Weren't the pants I was expecting. It's hard to find pants that fit just right and these do not fit just right. They're baggy."}, {"review_3"=>"I absolutely love these pants! They're an excellent fit and they look great! Looking forward to buying more for my business wardrobe and for weekend wear.."}, {"review_4"=>"I ordered AVERAGE LENGTH, plus size pants. When I buy pants, trousers, slacks or jeans in the store, I always buy AVERAGE LENGTH. All three pair were about 5 inches too long. I really hate the thought of taking them for alterations so I will probably return them this weekend."}, {"review_5"=>"Pants fit wonderful in fact I had room to spare in the size 16 short (normally size 18) very disappointed with the extremely long length, it was okay the day I ended up wearing the pants and hid the long length with tall boots ,however in order to wear these pants in the warmer months I will now have to pay and have then hemmed which means in essence I didn't save myself a dime after I have paid for tailoring service, please jcpenny get this inconsistent short sizing together"}, {"review_6"=>"Pleasantly surprised. Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"This dress is so cute. I ordered it online, because the selection for 2P is always very poor in the store. The fabric is very soft, and has some stretch to it. I chose to wear a slip with it, just to ensure it moves smoothly and is not transparent. Even though the fabric is pretty densely woven it is still whitish in color, and I expect than in strong light like a sunny day it would have a small of level of transparency. The only issue that I have with the dress, is the way the zipper was sewn around mid-back. name_title: Worthington® Seamless Cami - Petite
description: The perfect foundation for a variety of looks, our seamless jersey cami can be worn as a layer or alone. nylon/spandex washable imported
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I have had a black one for quite some time that I love wearing to bed because it doesn't get twisted as I toss and turn. Not only are they a bit form fitting, but there's a thin band around the bottom to hold it in place. It looks GREAT under sweaters too. These were on sale for a GREAT price so I got several more. I am a size 8-10 and bought the LG / XL."}, {"review_2"=>"This was for a gift and when I received it, I noticed the fabric was very smooth but yet thick enough to give support. My daughter Loved it!"}, {"review_3"=>"This is the second Worthington cami/tank top I've purchased and it will be the last. The material of this cami is substantial, but it has no give or stretch, and it's very short, despite the length shown in the picture. It wasn't comfortable on me and I felt like I was wearing a straitjacket, even though I ordered the correct size. I couldn't wait to take it off and returned it immediately. Others have had good luck with this line, so it may just be me and my body that don't agree with the product. Sorry, can't recommend this line."}, {"review_4"=>"For the past 5 years I have always and only purchased Worthington Cami's. They are truly the best cami I have ever worn. They wear like iron, wash great and don't roll up when you are wearing them. The color selection is reasonable."}, {"review_5"=>"I have bought these tanks twice over and in every color because they are the best. No black tank has ever looked so good with a pair of jeans. The other neutrals are great under cardigans or light weight blouses and I also wear mine around the house a lot. I also work out in mine. They are flattering no matter where you are wearing them. FYI the only reason I have two sets of most colors is because I wore some when I was pregnant all the way until the last day and I feel they stretched some but that was my fault and these actually wash extremely well. I wear one almost every single day and have had each one for at least three years (some five) and the fabric looks and feels brand new. I will agree with other reviewers that I would buy even more in other colors too. Make sure to get these on sale and they will pay for themselves VERY quickly."}, {"review_6"=>"I ordered the Large/XL and they did not even come close to fitting. I normally buy an XL in the Worthington line and they fit just fine. These are going back."}, {"review_7"=>"Layer under suits, cardigans, shrugs and dresses!!"}, {"review_8"=>"I have tried on too many Cami's to count, either they were too long or too compressing with ill fitting straps and unwanted lace. I have tried on all price ranges including some very high end brands with no success. I wanted a classic stretchy body hugging smooth not confining fit that would not cling to sheer tops but could be worn alone. That's not to much to ask so I thought. Then I found the Worthington Seamless Cami and my search was over. Never again will I need to look any further this one is just right. I bought both the regular and petite size (fits about 1-1/2 inches shorter) in several colors. The best Cami ever and what a great price!!!"}]}

name_title: Nesco® 18-qt. Stainless Steel Roaster Oven
description: Spacious 18-quart roaster oven is your portable, go-anywhere second oven that is capable of doing almost everything a traditional oven does, except broil.   accommodates up to a 22-pound turkey perfect for cooking large family meals like lasagna or baking tasty treats exclusive Circle of Heat® heating element cooks from the sides for moist, even cooking temperature settings from 200-450ºF allow you to slow cook, roast, bake, steam – as well as sear and brown foods removable porcelain cookwell for quick and easy cleanup a single chrome steel rack includes handles for easy insertion and removal of hot foods 1425 watts. Measures 23½x15x12"H. Cookwell is dishwasher-safe; roaster oven wipes clean. Imported.
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"This was delivered as promised.It is very good quality, Nesco is a fine product brand."}, {"review_2"=>"The first one I ordered was received extremely busted out the sides of the roaster and No it had nothing to do with the shipping. So I tried one last time again I am still not happy how it looks but it does not seem as bad. Here is my other issue with the roaster. The picture on the box and how it is supposed to look, all three of the roasters that I received does not look like the picture. Instead of it having the dial it had a knob for the temperature degree. So more it less, I love the size of the roaster, cooks really nice, but quality made-not great and box picture is different than the item itself."}, {"review_3"=>"Absolutely love my new Nesco Roaster Oven. name_title: a.n.a® Cropped Skinny Jeans - Tall
description: Our skinny jeans feature a comfortable cropped design that's a perfect fit for your casual style.   5-pocket style cotton/spandex washable imported tall: 28½" inseam misses: 26" inseam petite: 24" inseam
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I have two pairs of these jeans. I'm between a size 10 and 12 and a shorty (5'2\") so the length on these fit like regular (not cropped) skinny jeans. The fit of the \"midnight summer\" pair is lovely and flattering. The fabric has stretch, but is not too thin and keeps its shape. They have a comfortable mid-rise. I'd love to buy more of these jeans in different colors! Unfortunately, the black pair is like an entirely different product. The fabric has a rougher feel. Within 15 minutes of wearing them, they stretched out so much I was constantly hoisting them up. They have the look and feel of \"mom\" jeans.If you're considering buying these jeans, I'd recommend going to the store and trying them on in person. The product is not consistent enough to be reliably purchased online."}, {"review_2"=>"I'm a tad under 5'4\", which makes me nearly a petite, so don't even ask me why I decided to try these jeans in a size tall - divine intervention? It must have been, because they are fabulous! I bought several pairs in black, dark indigo and the deconstructed light wash. I ordered a size 10 (I weigh a few - ok, maybe like 30 more pounds than I should for my height), and the fit is comfy but not tight, with a length that hits right at the ankle. Perfect with tunic tees and tops. I anticipate getting a tremendous amount of wear from these jeans. Don't hesitate trying them. The price is right, and jcp makes returns so easy that you'd be crazy not to. They're really that good!"}, {"review_3"=>"These are a good weight and length and will take you from May to October. The fit is perfect, a bit higher in the waist and good to roll at the ankle. At 5'8\" they are good in the rise and leg length. I'll buy in every wash next year!! (they sold out early in my size)"}, {"review_4"=>"I decided to order these cropped skinny jeans on a whim--online without ever having tried this brand on before. What a pleasant surprise! They have become my favorite \"go to\" summer jeans. So comfy and so up to the minute styling. And the best part--they are a tremendous value. They compare to jeans that I have paid much much more for, but are only a fraction of the price. The only problem I've encountered is that after wearing a few times they tend to stretch out a bit so I have to wash them again so they regain their shape. Maybe I have to go down a size?"}, {"review_5"=>"I got mine today I ordered a size 12 in midnight and skywash. There is a little bit of difference on the fit. Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I am 5'0. The petite SP are perfect. I accidentally ordered petite P and they are too long. I love these pants! I purchased ( separate purchases - one in the store and one pair ordered at Penney's online site) two pairs of jeans in the indigo color, and I washed them before wearing. A few hours after putting on the first pair of jeans, my fingers and hands looked blue. The color was coming off on my skin and on the surfaces of chairs and the car seat. Furthermore, the material was covered with lint even though I could not locate a source for the lint. I tried wearing the second pair of jeans, and I experienced the same results. After using a lint roller and washing the pants two more times, I was hoping the problems had been solved. Instead, less dye was coming off on my skin and other objects, but the material attracted even more profuse amounts of lint. Needless to say, it was embarrassing to be seen in pants covered with lint pieces of various sizes. In order to keep up with the amount of lint the material attracts, I had to use a lint roller multiple times within an hour. I am quite unhappy. The two cons are 1)it doesn't have an auto shut off option. 2) The coffee brewing sizes could have 12 oz, 16 oz as I have pretty large travel mugs. However, I knew this before purchasing the Keurig. Oh and the color, I love Turquoise and it just brights up my kitchen!"}, {"review_3"=>"The K cup selections are endless. I love that because I find it very affordable to feed my coffee and tea love."}, {"review_4"=>"Overall, I was never big on coffee but now I find myself having a cup a day all thanks to Keurig. You have made a believer out of me."}, {"review_5"=>"Ok, so this is a saga..bear with me. It started in September when I ordered the \"old\" Keurig system, because I had heard too many negatives about the 2.0. Well, the old one, a K45, didn't work well at all. I complained and Keurig sent the K2.0 350 as a replacement. No better! They sent out a K2.0 300. It was the same. Took way over 2 minutes to brew a cup. In the meantime, as I am complaining to family and friends about the lengthy brew time, they informed me, three of them, that the K2.0 200 worked like a charm and delivered coffee quickly! As I called again about the horrible performance of the K2.0 300, Keurig graciously offered to upgrade to the more expensive model. I immediately said \"No, just send me the cheaper one, the K2.0 200, because I know this one has a good track record.\" This model works the best! Believe me!!! Fast brewing (50 seconds), hot, and you can use your own coffee pod to brew your own brand without using the expensive Kcups, if that is what you want to do!! It took me 4 Keurigs to finally get one that delivers. This one is finally a keeper!!!"}, {"review_6"=>"Received this product as a gift. After years of using my old Keurig Mini , I was excited to get the new 2.0. Bottom line, I went back to using my old keurig mini after about 2 weeks. Nothing I do removes the burnt plastic taste from my coffee. I have soaked all removable parts (water reservoir, k-cup holder, etc) in white vineagar over night, spent an hour running white vinegar and water cleanses through the machine, and I even washed all the removable parts in the dishwasher (something you're not supposed to do but it was my last resort). Nothing I do removes the plastic taste and smell. Everything I try to brew is undrinkable. Reading the reviews from other 2.0 owners, I see I am not the only one drinking coffee that tastes like a burnt barbie doll. I have been a loyal customer for years, and even recruited my parents to the brand (my mom owns a coffee shop so this was quiet a feat), but I am now fearful of the plastic being used in the new 2.0 brewers. This will probably be the last Keurig product I use."}, {"review_7"=>"I bought the Keurig to replace my coffee maker of a different brand. I was familiar with Keurig's however because we've always had one at work. First thing I realized: there aren't 9 sizes as advertised! I was excited about making a larger cup of coffee... but no go. Second the machine is loud. Why? And since I can only make a 10oz cup, why do I have to put so much water into the water reservoir? Lastly, what's the deal with the filter that is in the package, but mentioned no where in the instructions? So weird and incomplete. My coffee was good, but for the money, I want a product that was advertised and as good as the older models I've used in the past at work. I'm taking my K200 back."}, {"review_8"=>"even though some pods are labeled for use. such as Meijer brand. machine clogs up and coffee grounds go all over machine inside. went through 3 machines in 3 weeks. still not right. tech support even said that our filtered water was too clean. we replaced a 10+year old bun coffee maker that still works. thought this would be more convenient. we like the variety of pods. just wish that if it says keurig brewed on package. it would work properly."}, {"review_9"=>"It takes a lot to get me upset in the morning when I wake up. So imagine how upset I was when I could not make my first cup of coffee of the day ! I love the Keurig brand, but I love my coffee more. And this new 2.0 is not compatible with my reusable filter ! So i had to disconnect the new 2.0 and put in my old Keurig Elite B45 Brewer which accepts all types of reusable filters. I am on a fixed income and cannot afford to buy a specific filter or buy the Keurig brand K-cups. so most likely I will return this 2.0 ! As I stated before I love my coffee more than a machine to make it !!! Yes I like the touch screen and yes I like the compact design. I also like the fact that I can add a carafe as well and I am upset that I will not be able to enjoy these amenities ! I was really excited and was brimming with anticipation to use this Keurig 2.0 K200 ! And now with one issue(reusable filter),my hopes were shattered, and my morning ruined ! Thanks Keurig !"}, {"review_10"=>"I bought this product because it was on sale and I am on a tight budget and always wanted one. I bought it 3 days ago and it has only worked correctly for one day. I takes forever for it to heat and I have coffee grounds in my cup. I am always getting errors saying oops not a valid cup, which in fact it is. I am very said to say that I wasted my hard earned money on this product for a cup of coffee grounds. So if you are looking for a Kureg do buy this model. I am going to back to using my Mr. Coffee."}, {"review_11"=>"Our family drinks coffee every day and I serve coffee to a roomful of women every Monday. I loved my Keurig Classic but sadly it got tired. I decided to try this bigger one. What a mistake! I'm always having to clean grounds out of the needle. The reservoir needs refilling at halfway. Most irritating is I have 2 shelves of non-Keurig pods that I now cannot use because this machine won't accept them. How chintzy is that! Don't buy this one."}]}

So happy with this attentive service!"}, {"review_6"=>"I received these dishes as a Christmas present and they were lovely out of the box. I liked the look of them and all the different sized pieces. I could even overlook that the dinner plates are basically flat (they have no dip so food falls off easily if you tilt them) and started using them. Reviews: {"review"=>{"review_1"=>"I bought this pan about 2 months ago and have used it to grill fish, chicken, beef, baguette & panninis. The first few uses I had a bit of difficulty cleaning the pan, but then I read a fantastic hint for cleaning grill pans in the Food Network Magazine. After use, let the pan cool completely. Then sprinkle with Kosher salt and use a damp sponge that has a mild abrasive side. Scrub the pan lightly until clean and then rinse and dry. Voila!! the pan is like new. I would definitely recommend this pan, along with this cleaning technique. I forgot to mention that the red looks fantastic with the décor in my kitchen so it never has to be hidden in a cupboard!!"}}

Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"With different brands of JC Penney dress slacks, I go between a 2 short and a 4 petite. I am 5'4 and about 132lb and for this pant, I was able to fit a 4 petite. Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"I was looking for an alternative to my frumpy and \"don't go out in those\" way too casual sweat pants. I purchased my first pair of jeggings in my local JCP store and could not believe how wonderful they fit. I ordered two more pairs online. I will never go back to regular jeans again (in fact, I'm wearing them now as I write this review)."}, {"review_2"=>"The St. John's Bay Jeggings look like ordinary straight leg jeans. Pair them with a sweater or basically any other top and you cannot tell the difference. They are figure flattering and have a wide elastic waist band that does not bunch up or lose its shape even after washing and drying (I've washed them quite a bit since I purchased them and they do not shrink or lose their shape). They slip on like sweat pants but that's where the similarities end. They are unbelievably comfortable and I defy anyone to notice they are anything other than jeans. Can't tell the difference but you can feel the difference. I live in these pants - bought them in a couple of colors and have not worn my actual jeans since these jeggings arrived. I am a jeggings convert. These are great,. Super Comfortable, nice looking and they come in different colors (I got black and blue). Thanks, JCP"}, {"review_3"=>"Love the quality and fit. I got them on clearance and very pleased. They look like pants but have the stretch and comfort of jeggings. The color was darker than I thought but still able to go with many things. Like that they came in petite sizes."}, {"review_4"=>"I've seriously thought of buying a dozen pair of these, just in case you discontinue them. please don't! would love to see them offered in summer colors as well. so comfortable, so easy, and truly surprised me. I'd tried on \"skinny jeans\" and jeggings at many stores, many types/manufacturers. was always a horror or laugh riot. was at JCP and thought I might as well try just one more style. voila! perfect. wore them all winter with sweaters and boots, comfortable even on very long road trips. love these!! my daughter got a pair for postpartum wear, she loves them too, they don't bind you anywhere and \"sit\" so comfortably!"}, {"review_5"=>"These have not only great quality but great , accurate fit as well. I totally love them! Very good price also!"}, {"review_6"=>"It has been extremely hard for me to find a great pair of jeans, especially after having kids and a number of health issues that prevent me from wearing jeans with a regular buckle. These jeggings by St. John's Bay are wonderful! They are definitely more like jeans, but they're stretchy, and the waistband on top stays in place and doesn't dig into my stomach, which is key. I am 5'7\", 120 lbs, and the small fit perfectly. Please don't ever stop making them! I want some in every color! :)"}, {"review_7"=>"I tried these on a last minute whim because leggings rarely look really good on me. I detest low-rise too-tight waist bands that give you a muffin top. These do not. Nice wide band, and are made well enough not to cling to all the not-so-attractive areas! They are modern, not your Grammas pull-on jeans. I ordered three more pairs recently and I hardly ever do that! I'm a size 8-10 and the medium is just right. The ankle is a perfect length, tidy inside boots but look great with flats or low sneakers. Dress em up or down."}, {"review_8"=>"I ordered the XL size. I am thin in the lower body, i.e. legs and hips but wear a size 18 for waist size. Classic apple shape. My inseam is 31 inches. I am 5'6\". These jeggings fit me perfectly with a little extra length in case of potential length shrinkage after washing/drying. The material is sturdy and the dye quality is consistent. The waistband is just a bit a little higher than I expected but it is extremely comfortable and not binding or tight when sitting. All in all a very good product."}, {"review_9"=>"My daughter really loves the Jeggings I ordered for her online. Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"These pants are very comfortable. I am no longer able to wear tight pants or jeans due to an illness so I began the search for something looser fitting. I was a bit unsure of what to get but when I saw these I decided to give them a try. I wear them when we are out running errands and for doctor appts, etc. As for size I am 5'3\" & 160 lbs and I wear the \"XL Short\" but can also wear size \"L Short\" if I want the legs to be a bit tighter (but the tummy and waist are also more snug in the size \"Large\", ha!). Hope this helps, I always wish people would give their size and weight so I could know if I would be able to wear things."}, {"review_2"=>"I really loved the style of these pants and JCP didn't have them in a tall size, so I thought I'd try a regular inseam. They are super short ... I need just a 33.5-34\" inseam and I think these were closer to barely 30\"."}, {"review_3"=>"I'm built straight up and down, with not much of a waist and narrow hips and thighs and a normal/regular belly. These pants were big in the waist and tight in the thighs, which is normally a good fit for my body type, but not with these. There is no string at the waist to adjust them, and the rise is so low, (maybe an 8\" rise??) that there would be no way they would stay up. I couldn't go up a size to have a bigger thigh bc then the waist and butt would be huge."}, {"review_4"=>"Still, they are very nicely made and the seaming on them made them really flattering. Had they been available in a tall length I would have repurchased them and taken them to a tailor to take them in at the waist, bc I really did like them that much."}, {"review_5"=>"Bummer! JCP -- you say you sell Talls, but they're rarely ever available!"}, {"review_6"=>"These fit good, feel good, and had a great price. Hope they last a long time too."}, {"review_7"=>"I absolutely LOVE these pants.I have 3 pairs of black and 3 pairs of gray. Really comfortable, Fit in length is really good!"}, {"review_8"=>"I have 10 pairs of these pants. I wear them every day to work, gym, everywhere. That being said, I just purchased 2 blacks and 2 grays to keep my stock up (they're saved in my favorites so I know I ordered the same ones as always). I was just going to hang them in the closet but decided to try them on just to make sure of the fit, etc. Imagine my surprise when I had to shimmy into them. If I wanted a girdle, I would have bought one.So here's my scathing review of these miserable pants:I am 5'4\" with an inseam of 30\". The average length is not.NEW inseam=33-1/4\". ORIGINAL=32\".NEW rise=11\". ORIGINAL=10\".The NEW Slim-Fit cut is 1/2\" more narrow than the ORIGINAL (N=8-1/4\" at knee vs O=8-3/4\" at the knee).The fabric content has not changed so I do not understand the difference in the feel of the fabric but it does feel thinner, cheaper. The country of origin has not changed either. The only thing that has changed is the pattern shape.Finally analysis: The new pattern sits higher on the waist, is longer on the length, and slimmer on the leg.If this is how the pants are going to continue I will be taking them off my favorites list because nobody should have to shimmy into their clothes-ever."}, {"review_9"=>"These pants are fantastic for exercise or dance. True to size in my opinion, look great, quality stitching, and I can move my legs freely. Good buy"}, {"review_10"=>"I have skinny legs (below my knees) and have stayed away from yoga pants since they've become popular. I love these pants. I wore them today for the first time and received compliments from my friends."}, {"review_11"=>"My new Xersion slim-fit pants are true to size which means I do not feel like an encased sausage while I am working out at the local gym nor do I look like one. I wish that the pocket was bigger but that is really of no consequence. These pants launder beautifully and do not draw up neither do they get baggy during wear. I really like that they come in petites so that I did not have to do any alterations. All in all they are a good wearing experience."}]}

name_title: Nostalgia Electrics™ Countertop Kettle Popcorn Machine
description: Pop up some family fun with this countertop kettle popcorn machine that's perfect for parties, movie nights and media rooms. It features a large stainless steel kettle with a built-in stirring system for plenty of delicious popcorn that's made with ease.    makes 1-2 quarts per batch  includes kernel measuring cup and oil measuring spoon easy to clean in red or black Popcorn kit, sold separately, includes: 16-ounce all-natural soft-shelled popping corn 10½-ounce butter-flavored popcorn oil three 0.9-ounce jars of seasonings: nacho cheddar, white cheddar and ranch
Reviews: {"review"=>[{"review_1"=>"the grandkids think its the greatest thing ever they only thought popcorn came from a microwave. fun to make a taste great too"}, {"review_2"=>"Initally upon opening, I was thrilled with this popcorn maker. It is so cute! And it fit in perfectly with my decor and the space I had available ton my counter.Unfortunately, the popcorn and the process of making the popcorn were a big disappointment.First off the popcorn: the popped corn was tough and there were as many old maids as there were popped kernals. It made a VERY small batch, one in which you had to be on your guard while eating in order to maintain all of your teeth.Second the machine itself: Even though we used the measuring cups for the oil and popcorn, the machine \"clogged\" up while popping and we had to stop it and clean out the popper during the popping process.Also, it was very crowded inside the machine itself just to access the inner kettle in order to get the oil and the kernals loaded without spilling all over.It was also tricky to remove the popcorn from the machine without grabbing each handful. Cleanup: difficult, as there is no pan or anything to remove, you just have to go in and remove all the old maids, etc. by hand and then wipe down with a rag.We tried four batches, but all four were lousy.I would not recommend this product unless you just want it for display. It's very cute!"}, {"review_3"=>"I have been wanting one of these for so long - I had the extra 20% off coupon so i bought it. Got it home, bought popcorn and oil and unboxed it. My kids were so excited. It turned and turned and nothing. We shut it off, turned it back on and finally we could hear the sizzle and 'pop' 'pop' - more kernels shot out then popped corn. Kids got their popcorn, needed to make 2 batches for 3 kids (18, 11, 9 yr). Popcorn was a little chewy - but expected -not like air popped. It was easy clean up - while wiping down the plastic walls, there were these melted spots where the the hot kernels hit the walls. I only could envision it after 5 more uses... a popcorn popper with chicken pox. It went back. Great idea - I would have paid a little more for glass walls."}, {"review_4"=>"I got this as a gift for my boyfriend for xmas! He loves popcorn! It was very easy to put together and really easy to use. 2 things I would want to mention is that there are little vent slits on both sides to let the heat out. The kernels and little pieces of popcorn shoot out of these slits while it's popping. Which I don't really mind, I just pick them up afterwards. The second and biggest issue I have is that its kind of hard to clean. The metal part that pops the kernels does come out but getting inside it to clean it is complicated, the unit itself, and the metal part. It makes you not want to use it as much knowing your going to have to spend so much time cleaning it. All in all he loved it so it was worth it!"}, {"review_5"=>"I was very excited to get this popcorn popper!!! See My friend has the larger model (the one with the wheels) and i just loved the popcorn from her machine!!! the popcorn was warm and YUMMY!!! When i decided to get one(the very next day) I went and ordered this one-the smaller unit because i do not have much floor space to have the larger unit in my kitchen. I was very bummed when I made the first batch most of the kernals did not pop-you need to cook like 2 or 3 batches then recook the unpopped kernals. also the plastic walls cracked and blistered. After 3 weeks I returned it and ordered the larger one for 50.00 more. ALSO get the 1 year service contract!!!!"}, {"review_6"=>"Bought this for my popcorn loving husband . It has been used at least 3 or more times a week for the last 9 months. He has mastered the technique of corn popping. Let the unit warm up first then add the popcorn carefully by turning the metal container towards you a bit while pouring the kernels in. He hasn't been burned yet. We have tried all brands of corn and none are any better than the next. Kernels left over are vacuum out with a shop vac, then wiped out; a 2 minute job. Buying one for my son's family for Christmas. One other comment the handle was complicated, the rule of righty tighty does not apply it is the opposite (go left or counter clockwise)."}, {"review_7"=>"I bought this popcorn maker based on the previous reviews. Boy was I 100% wrong - first this popcorn maker does not come with any popcorn - at leastt they should throw in 1 bag to say thanks!! It says it comes with a heating lamp - it is just a light bulb and it will never heat anything. Within the first 5 minutes the cheaply made plastic turning rod broke off and the metal ended up in the popcorn that barely even popped 1/2 way with kernals flying over the place - do yourself a favor get a hot-air popper for $20 and you'll do yourself a favor."}, {"review_8"=>"I read all the reviews before buying, so I knew people were divided in their opinions. My family is a big fan of this popper. We have it sitting on the bar, and it nearly always has popcorn in it. We like the taste of the popcorn it makes, and we love having popcorn available to eat all the time. We found that by giving the oil a brief time to get hot before adding the popcorn we had very few \"old maids\". My grandchildren are thrilled to always have popcorn available at my house. This is a great appliance at a great price."}]}
